metadata.synopsis: The Hag is about to perform her eye-extraction and replanting on you. She is in her hag form in all its disgusting glory. Initially she's happy and feeling powerful -- but when she finds out your tadpole is Netherese, she becomes angry; not quite frightened, but anxious about having that magic in her home. She wants you out and has no more patience for you.

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: Not you, you eejit. I need someone with two eyes in their skull.

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: There you are. Now where were we?
65.context: NodeContext: Coy greeting - like you're about to have some fun but at the player's expense

75.text: Much better. That human skin is fierce restrictive.
75.context: NodeContext: You've just transformed into a towering monstrous hag. You are LOVING IT. Give your shoulders a luxurious stretch as you settle into your true form. You can't wait for the player's reaction. Like a cat purring as they stretch out,

6.speaker: Player
6.text: So the brothers were right. You are a hag.

3.text: Indeed I am. And a fabulous one at that.
3.context: NodeContext: Grinning and flirtatious but in a very  very creepy way

58.text: Not many get to see a hag in all her glory. Consider yourself blessed.
58.context: NodeContext: You are like a QUEEN, gesturing to yourself dramatically - loving the DRAMA of it all

18.text: Now choose. Which eye will it be? Right or left?
18.context: NodeContext: The big moment - pausing for dramatic effect, holds up hand for right/left

34.text: Hold onto your knickers. This might sting a bit.
34.context: NodeContext: You know this is going to sting a lot more than a bit. Big cruel smil. Flexing your fingers in delight.

57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hag raises her forearm, fingers straightened to a point as if a blade and drives her hand towards the player's face. Rips her hand back, shot of the eye on her nail (maybe?) and then she either - kisses it gently or wave her hand over it (whatever is easier) and then jams it back into the player's head.

71.text: Now - that wasn't so bad, was it?
71.context: NodeContext: You know it was bad. Very bad. Satisfied smirk on your face.

60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hag took the left eye

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Check that your eye is still there.

20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot as player holds a hand up to their eyes - their chosen eye now shines bright green|NodeContext: Flirtatious

16.text: Now - unless you want tentacles for a tongue, stay absolutely still.
16.context: NodeContext: Down to business - you mean to uphold your end of the bargain and remove the parasite.Readying yourself to work some indredibly powerful magic.

42.text: I've removed one of these buggers before - but it's a touch tricky.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Perhaps flexing her taloned fingers, loosening up as she prepares to work some powerful magic. NodeContext: Down to business - you mean to uphold your end of the bargain and remove the parasite.Readying yourself to work some indredibly powerful magic. Perhaps elegantly stretching a little, glexing your fingers as you settle in.

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *The parasite squirms at the hag's words. Pain builds behind your eye.*
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hag - low guttural murmuring noise as she moves around the player, swaying and dancing, her clawed fingers and hips swaying.

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *You feel the creature writhe as it's dragged towards your ear...*
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player character puts hands over ears. Hag - moving faster.

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *...then it bites back, burrowing even deeper into your brain.*
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player character grimaces in pain. Hag is pushed back -clutching her hand as if bitten, hissing in pain.

31.context: NodeContext: Screeching in pain - jumping back and clutching and shaking your hand as if burned

29.text: You little shit - you didn't tell me it was Netherese. I'm not touching that.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hag stands back, looking angry and afraid. She’s breathing heavily, cowering a little like a wounded animal.NodeContext: You srtand back looking angry and afraid - breathing heavily. Absolute VENOM in your voice.

27.text: Filthy shadow magic - brings nothing but chains and misery.
27.context: NodeContext: Half spitting this - disgust and hatred in your voice

56.text: How could I have missed the stink? Like blood and piss congealing on my tongue. Bleh.
56.context: NodeContext: Almost gagging at the end. Utter disgust in your voice.

15.text: Someone's tampered with your parasite. That's likely why you've not turned yet.

19.text: Bless us, you're as slow as a wet week. That thing has been touched by more than mind flayers.
19.context: NodeContext: Rolling your eyes in the first part - the player is relly not getting it.

66.text: You're a dead soul walking. I can't help you.
66.context: NodeContext: Said with a sneer - the player is dead in a matter of days and you don't care

11.text: What about it? I held up my end of the bargain.
11.context: NodeContext: Offended at the player's implication. You can do your job perfectly - it's the player's fault in your eyes

61.text: It's not my fault the wriggler's tainted by shadow magic. I want nothing to do with you or that scum in your brain.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I'm not leaving. This wasn't the deal.

2.text: You're bloody right it wasn't. I agreed to remove an illithid spawn. That thing is an abomination.

73.text: But let it not be said that Auntie Ethel doesn't honour her debts.
73.context: NodeContext: Rolling your eyes, You will give them something - you can't have you repurtation tarnished.

43.text: Here. It's on you to fix yourself.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hold out open palm dramatically. Amulet appears in it suddenly. Gives it to player.

14.context: NodeContext: Cold and unrelenting - you're no longer afraid of the player but you don't want them in your house any longer

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Which is your way of saying - you're not powerful enough.

8.text: I'd kill you for that - but why deny your wriggler the pleasure?
8.context: NodeContext: A nasty and cruel jab at the player's weakspot

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Then you're of no use to me.

1.text: You don't want to mess with such folk. Trust me - there are worse things than becoming a mind flayer.
1.context: NodeContext: Rolling your eyes as the player walks away. You will give them something - you can't have you repurtation tarnished.

21.text: Here. Don't let it be said that Auntie doesn't honour her deals. It's on you to fix yourself.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hold out open palm dramatically. Amulet appears in it suddenly. Gives it to player.NodeContext: Grim - you don't want your reputation tarnish, though you think the player is dead either way

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I thought you could remove it?

62.text: I can! But that thing has been touched by more than mind flayers.
62.context: NodeContext: Offended at the player's implication. You can do your job perfectly - it's the player's fault in your eyes

49.speaker: Player
49.text: All the more reason to remove it - or else.

50.context: NodeContext: Said with a sneer - the player can do nothing to you

38.text: Strong and silent - good. You'll need it for this next bit.

59.text: Hah! Oh, you do make me laugh.

68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hag took the right eye

33.speaker: Player
33.text: What in the hells are you?

25.text: Close that mouth, precious. Lest you swallow a fly.
25.context: NodeContext: You are LOVING the player's surprise. Flirtatious but in a very creepy way.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Cute. Am I supposed to be impressed?

51.text: Well, yes - I should bloody think so.
51.context: NodeContext: Player is not impressed by your transformation. You're shocked. Everyone is always impressed.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Give me one reason why I shouldn't cut you down.

76.text: Watch that tongue, petal. I bite.
76.context: NodeContext: Player has hinted that they'll attack you - you cheerfully, but steel, remind them that you are not one to be messed with

67.text: This is my house. And you will mind your manners - or I will use that empty skull of yours as a teapot.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: A green hag. And a powerful specimen, it seems.

35.text: Thank you, petal. It is so lovely to be appreciated.

64.text: Magic is the lifeblood of hags. And I'm one of the best.
64.context: NodeContext: There is no showboating here. She's powerful and she knows it - this is the truth.
